mathematics used in units of volume to show when the length of something has been multiplied by its width and height: A cubic centimeter is a centimeter high, a centimeter long, and a centimeter wide.

MEASURES used in units of volume to show when the length of something has been multiplied by its width and height: 7 million cubic litres of water can be stored in the reservoir.
